71 
72  if( clear_cache ) {
73  mood_face_cache.reset();
74  }
75 
76  if( mood_face_cache.has_value() && mood_face_horizontal == option_horizontal ) {
77  return mood_face_cache.value();
78  }
79 
80  mood_face_horizontal = option_horizontal;
81  std::string face_type;
82  for( const trait_id &mut : get_mutations() ) {
83  if( !mut->threshold ) {
84  continue;
85  }
86  face_type = mut.str();
87  break;
88  }
89 
90  // Valid: DEFAULT and DEFAULT_HORIZONTAL
91  if( face_type.empty() ) {
92  face_type = "DEFAULT";
93  }
94 
95  if( mood_face_horizontal ) {
96  face_type.append( "_HORIZONTAL" );
97  }
98 
99  // Valid: THRESH_MUT and THRESH_MUT_HORIZONTAL
100  // Example: THRESH_BIRD and THRESH_BIRD_HORIZONTAL
101  for( const mood_face &face_id : mood_face::get_all() ) {
102  if( face_id.getId().str() == face_type ) {
103  mood_face_cache = face_id.getId();
104  break;
105  }
106  }
107 
108  // If we didn't get it first try, we're not getting it again
109  if( !mood_face_cache.has_value() ) {
110  if( mood_face_horizontal ) {
111  mood_face_cache = mood_face_DEFAULT_HORIZONTAL;
112  } else {
113  mood_face_cache = mood_face_DEFAULT;
114  }
115  }
116 
117  return mood_face_cache.value();
118 }

◆ control_npc()

void avatar::control_npc ( npc &  np,
bool  debug = false 
)

Makes the avatar "take over" the given NPC, while the current avatar character becomes an NPC.

Definition at line 176 of file avatar.cpp.

177 {
178  if( !np.is_player_ally() ) {
179  debugmsg( "control_npc() called on non-allied npc %s", np.name );
180  return;
181  }
182  character_id new_character = np.getID();
183  const std::function<void( npc & )> update_npc = [new_character]( npc & guy ) {
184  guy.update_missions_target( get_avatar().getID(), new_character );
185  };
186  overmap_buffer.foreach_npc( update_npc );
187  mission().update_world_missions_character( get_avatar().getID(), new_character );
188  // move avatar character data into shadow npc
189  swap_character( get_shadow_npc() );
190  // swap target npc with shadow npc
191  std::swap( get_shadow_npc(), np );
192  // move shadow npc character data into avatar
193  swap_character( get_shadow_npc() );
194  // the avatar character is no longer a follower NPC
195  g->remove_npc_follower( getID() );
196  // the previous avatar character is now a follower
197  g->add_npc_follower( np.getID() );
198  np.set_fac( faction_your_followers );
199  // perception and mutations may have changed, so reset light level caches
200  g->reset_light_level();
201  // center the map on the new avatar character
202  const bool z_level_changed = g->vertical_shift( posz() );
203  g->update_map( *this, z_level_changed );

void avatar::control_npc_menu ( bool  debug = false)

212 {
213  std::vector<shared_ptr_fast<npc>> followers;
214  uilist charmenu;
215  int charnum = 0;
216  for( const character_id &elem : g->get_follower_list() ) {
217  shared_ptr_fast<npc> follower = overmap_buffer.find_npc( elem );
218  if( follower ) {
219  followers.emplace_back( follower );
220  charmenu.addentry( charnum++, true, MENU_AUTOASSIGN, follower->get_name() );
221  }
222  }
223  if( followers.empty() ) {
224  popup( _( "There's no one to take control of!" ) );
225  return;
226  }
227  charmenu.w_y_setup = 0;
228  charmenu.query();
229  if( charmenu.ret < 0 || static_cast<size_t>( charmenu.ret ) >= followers.size() ) {
230  return;
231  }

◆ create()

bool avatar::create ( character_type  type,
const std::string &  tempname = "" 
)

Definition at line 667 of file newcharacter.cpp.

668 {
669  set_wielded_item( item() );
670 
671  prof = profession::generic();
672  set_scenario( scenario::generic() );
673 
674  const bool interactive = type != character_type::NOW &&
675  type != character_type::FULL_RANDOM;
676 
677  std::vector<std::string> character_tabs = {
678  _( "POINTS" ),
679  _( "SCENARIO" ),
680  _( "PROFESSION" ),
681  //~ Not scenery/backdrop, but previous life up to this point
682  _( "BACKGROUND" ),
683  _( "STATS" ),
684  _( "TRAITS" ),
685  _( "SKILLS" ),
686  _( "DESCRIPTION" ),
687  };
688  tab_manager tabs( character_tabs );
689 
690  const std::string point_pool = get_option<std::string>( "CHARACTER_POINT_POOLS" );
691  pool_type pool = pool_type::FREEFORM;
692  if( point_pool == "multi_pool" ) {
693  // if using legacy multipool only set it to that
694  pool = pool_type::MULTI_POOL;
695  }
696 
697  switch( type ) {
698  case character_type::CUSTOM:
699  randomize_cosmetics();
700  break;
701  case character_type::RANDOM:
702  //random scenario, default name if exist
703  randomize( true );
704  tabs.position.last();
705  break;
706  case character_type::NOW:
707  //default world, fixed scenario, random name
708  randomize( false, true );
709  break;
710  case character_type::FULL_RANDOM:
711  //default world, random scenario, random name
712  randomize( true, true );
713  break;
714  case character_type::TEMPLATE:
715  if( !load_template( tempname, /*out*/ pool ) ) {
716  return false;
717  }
718 
719  // We want to prevent recipes known by the template from being applied to the
720  // new character. The recipe list will be rebuilt when entering the game.
721  // Except if it is a character transfer template
722  if( pool != pool_type::TRANSFER ) {
723  forget_all_recipes();
724  }
725  tabs.position.last();
726  break;
727  }
728 
729  // Don't apply the default backgrounds on a template
730  if( type != character_type::TEMPLATE ) {
731  add_default_background();
732  }
733 
734  auto nameExists = [&]( const std::string & name ) {
735  return world_generator->active_world->save_exists( save_t::from_save_id( name ) ) &&
736  !query_yn( _( "A save with the name '%s' already exists in this world.\n"
737  "Saving will overwrite the already existing character.\n\n"
738  "Continue anyways?" ), name );
739  };
740  set_body();
741  const bool allow_reroll = type == character_type::RANDOM;
742  do {
743  if( !interactive ) {
744  // no window is created because "Play now" does not require any configuration
745  if( nameExists( name ) ) {
746  return false;
747  }
748 
749  break;
750  }
751 
752  if( pool == pool_type::TRANSFER ) {
753  tabs.position.last();
754  }
755 
756  switch( tabs.position.cur_index() ) {
757  case 0:
758  set_points( tabs, *this, /*out*/ pool );
759  break;
760  case 1:
761  set_scenario( tabs, *this, pool );
762  break;
763  case 2:
764  set_profession( tabs, *this, pool );
765  break;
766  case 3:
767  set_hobbies( tabs, *this, pool );
768  break;
769  case 4:
770  set_stats( tabs, *this, pool );
771  break;
772  case 5:
773  set_traits( tabs, *this, pool );
774  break;
775  case 6:
776  set_skills( tabs, *this, pool );
777  break;
778  case 7:
779  set_description( tabs, *this, allow_reroll, pool );
780  break;
781  }
782 
783  if( tabs.quit ) {
784  return false;
785  }
786  } while( !tabs.complete );
787 
788  if( pool == pool_type::TRANSFER ) {
789  return true;
790  }
791 
792  save_template( _( "Last Character" ), pool );
793 
794  initialize( type );
795 
796  return true;
797 }

◆ disarm()

void avatar::disarm ( npc &  target)

Try to disarm the NPC.

May result in fail attempt, you receiving the weapon and instantly wielding it, or the weapon falling down on the floor nearby. NPC is always getting angry with you.

Parameters
targetTarget NPC to disarm

@ARM_STR increases chance to disarm, primary stat

Dexterity increases chance to disarm, secondary stat

Grip strength modifies all disarm rolls

Melee increases chance to disarm Unarmed increases chance to disarm, bonus when nothing wielded

Definition at line 2845 of file melee.cpp.

2846 {
2847  if( !target.is_armed() ) {
2848  return;
2849  }
2850 
2851  if( target.is_hallucination() ) {
2852  target.on_attacked( *this );
2853  return;
2854  }
2855 
2856  /** @ARM_STR increases chance to disarm, primary stat */
2857  /** @EFFECT_DEX increases chance to disarm, secondary stat */
2858  /** Grip strength modifies all disarm rolls */
2859  int my_roll = dice( 3, get_limb_score( limb_score_grip ) * get_arm_str() + get_dex() );
2860 
2861  /** @EFFECT_MELEE increases chance to disarm */
2862  my_roll += dice( 3, round( get_skill_level( skill_melee ) ) );
2863 
2864  int their_roll = dice( 3, target.get_limb_score( limb_score_grip ) * target.get_arm_str() +
2865  target.get_dex() );
2866  their_roll *= target.get_limb_score( limb_score_reaction );
2867  their_roll += dice( 3, round( target.get_skill_level( skill_melee ) ) );
2868 
2869  item_location it = target.get_wielded_item();
2870  const item_location weapon = get_wielded_item();
2871 
2872  if( it->has_flag( flag_INTEGRATED ) ) {
2873  return;
2874  };
2875 
2876  // roll your melee and target's dodge skills to check if grab/smash attack succeeds
2877  int hitspread = target.deal_melee_attack( this, hit_roll() );
2878  if( hitspread < 0 ) {
2879  add_msg( _( "You lunge for the %s, but miss!" ), it->tname() );
2880  item weap = get_wielded_item() ? *get_wielded_item() : null_item_reference();
2881  mod_moves( -100 - stumble( *this, weapon ) - attack_speed( weap ) );
2882  target.on_attacked( *this );
2883  return;
2884  }
2885 
2886  map &here = get_map();
2887  // hitspread >= 0, which means we are going to disarm by grabbing target by their weapon
2888  if( !is_armed() ) {
2889  /** @EFFECT_UNARMED increases chance to disarm, bonus when nothing wielded */
2890  my_roll += dice( 3, round( get_skill_level( skill_unarmed ) ) );
2891 
2892  if( my_roll >= their_roll ) {
2893  //~ %s: weapon name
2894  add_msg( _( "You grab at %s and pull with all your force!" ), it->tname() );
2895  //~ %1$s: weapon name, %2$s: NPC name
2896  add_msg( _( "You forcefully take %1$s from %2$s!" ), it->tname(), target.get_name() );
2897  // wield() will deduce our moves, consider to deduce more/less moves for balance
2898  item rem_it = target.i_rem( &*it );
2899  wield( rem_it );
2900  } else if( my_roll >= their_roll / 2 ) {
2901  add_msg( _( "You grab at %s and pull with all your force, but it drops nearby!" ),
2902  it->tname() );
2903  const tripoint tp = target.pos() + tripoint( rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ), 0 );
2904  here.add_item_or_charges( tp, target.i_rem( &*it ) );
2905  mod_moves( -100 );
2906  } else {
2907  add_msg( _( "You grab at %s and pull with all your force, but in vain!" ), it->tname() );
2908  mod_moves( -100 );
2909  }
2910 
2911  target.on_attacked( *this );
2912  } else {
2913  // Make their weapon fall on floor if we've rolled enough.
2914  mod_moves( -100 - attack_speed( *get_wielded_item() ) );
2915  if( my_roll >= their_roll ) {
2916  add_msg( _( "You smash %s with all your might forcing their %s to drop down nearby!" ),
2917  target.get_name(), it->tname() );
2918  const tripoint tp = target.pos() + tripoint( rng( -1, 1 ), rng( -1, 1 ), 0 );
2919  here.add_item_or_charges( tp, target.i_rem( &*it ) );
2920  } else {
2921  add_msg( _( "You smash %s with all your might but %s remains in their hands!" ),
2922  target.get_name(), it->tname() );
2923  }
2924 
2925  target.on_attacked( *this );
2926  }
2927 }

850  for( std::string &line : textformatted ) {
851  if( i - info_scroll_position >= INFO_CUTOFF ) {
852  break;
853  }
854  if( i++ >= info_scroll_position ) {

903  .viewport_size( INFO_SCROLL_POINT + 1 )
904  .scroll_to_last( true )
905  .apply( wMedical );
906 
907  wnoutrefresh( wMedical );
908  } );
909 
910  input_context ctxt( "MEDICAL" );
911  ctxt.register_action( "UP" );
912  ctxt.register_action( "DOWN" );
913  ctxt.register_action( "LEFT" );
914  ctxt.register_action( "RIGHT" );
915  ctxt.register_action( "APPLY" );
916  ctxt.register_action( "HELP_KEYBINDINGS" );
917  ctxt.register_action( "SCROLL_INFOBOX_UP", to_translation( "Scroll up" ) );
918  ctxt.register_action( "SCROLL_INFOBOX_DOWN", to_translation( "Scroll down" ) );
919  ctxt.register_action( "QUIT" );
920 
921  for( ;; ) {
922  ui_manager::redraw();
923  const std::string action = ctxt.handle_input();
924 
925  if( action == "DOWN" || action == "UP" ) {
926  const int step = cursor.y + ( action == "DOWN" ? 1 : -1 );
927  const int limit = cursor_bounds[cursor.x] - 1;
928 
929  if( step == -1 ) {
930  cursor.y = limit;
931  } else if( step > limit ) {
932  cursor.y = 0;
933  } else {
934  cursor.y = step;
935  }
936 
937  const int scroll_overflow = limit - SCROLL_POINT;
938  if( scroll_overflow > 0 ) {
939  const int half_list = SCROLL_POINT / 2;
940  scroll_position = std::max( 0, std::min( scroll_overflow, cursor.y - half_list ) );
941  }
942  info_scroll_position = 0;
943  } else if( action == "RIGHT" || action == "LEFT" ) {
944  const int step = cursor.x + ( action == "RIGHT" ? 1 : -1 );
945  const int limit = 2;
946  if( step == -1 ) {
947  cursor.x = limit;
948  } else if( step > limit ) {
949  cursor.x = 0;
950  } else {
951  cursor.x = step;
952  }
953 
954  // Match the cursor to the nearest row on the next column.
955  const int y_limit = cursor_bounds[cursor.x] - 1;
956  cursor.y = std::min( cursor.y - scroll_position, y_limit );
957 
958  const int scroll_overflow = y_limit - SCROLL_POINT;
959  if( scroll_overflow > 0 ) {
960  const int half_list = SCROLL_POINT / 2;
961  scroll_position = std::max( 0, std::min( scroll_overflow, cursor.y - half_list ) );
962  } else {
963  scroll_position = 0;
964  }
965  info_scroll_position = 0;
966  } else if( action == "APPLY" ) {
967  avatar_action::use_item( *this );
968  } else if( action == "SCROLL_INFOBOX_UP" || action == "SCROLL_INFOBOX_DOWN" ) {
969  const int scroll_overflow = info_lines - INFO_SCROLL_POINT - 1;
970  if( scroll_overflow > 0 ) {
971  const int step = info_scroll_position + ( action == "SCROLL_INFOBOX_DOWN" ? 1 : -1 );
972 
973  if( step == -1 ) {
974  info_scroll_position = scroll_overflow;
975  } else if( step > scroll_overflow ) {
976  info_scroll_position = 0;
977  } else {
978  info_scroll_position = step;
979  }
980  } else {
981  info_scroll_position = 0;
982  }
983  } else if( action == "QUIT" ) {
984  break;
985  }
986  }
987 }

700 {
701  const auto update_memory =
702  [this]( const object_type gtype, const tripoint & gpoint, const bool erase ) {
703  map &m = get_map();
704  if( gtype == object_type::VEHICLE ) {
705  if( const optional_vpart_position ovp = m.veh_at( pos() + gpoint ) ) {
706  for( const tripoint &target : ovp->vehicle().get_points() ) {
707  if( erase ) {
708  memorize_clear_decoration( m.getglobal( target ), /* prefix = */ "vp_" );
709  }
710  m.memory_cache_dec_set_dirty( target, true );
711  }
712  }
713  } else if( gtype != object_type::NONE ) {
714  if( erase ) {
715  memorize_clear_decoration( m.getglobal( pos() + gpoint ) );
716  }
717  m.memory_cache_dec_set_dirty( pos() + gpoint, true );
718  }
719  };

721  update_memory( grab_type, grab_point, /* erase = */ false );

758  const auto &reading = item.type->book;
759  const skill_id &skill = reading->skill;
760 
761  add_msg( _( "You skim %s to find out what's in it." ), book.type_name() );
762  if( skill && get_skill_level_object( skill ).can_train() ) {
763  add_msg( m_info, _( "Can bring your %s knowledge to %d." ),
764  skill.obj().name(), reading->level );
765  if( reading->req != 0 ) {
766  add_msg( m_info, _( "Requires %1$s knowledge level %2$d to understand." ),
767  skill.obj().name(), reading->req );
768  }
769  }
770 
771  if( reading->intel != 0 ) {
772  add_msg( m_info, _( "Requires intelligence of %d to easily read." ), reading->intel );
773  }
774  //It feels wrong to use a pointer to *this, but I can't find any other player pointers in this method.
775  if( book_fun_for( book, *this ) != 0 ) {
776  add_msg( m_info, _( "Reading this book affects your morale by %d." ), book_fun_for( book, *this ) );
777  }
778 
779  if( book.type->use_methods.count( "MA_MANUAL" ) ) {
780  const matype_id style_to_learn = martial_art_learned_from( *book.type );
781  add_msg( m_info, _( "You can learn %s style from it." ), style_to_learn->name );
782  add_msg( m_info, _( "This fighting style is %s to learn." ),
783  martialart_difficulty( style_to_learn ) );
784  add_msg( m_info, _( "It would be easier to master if you'd have skill expertise in %s." ),
785  style_to_learn->primary_skill->name() );
786  add_msg( m_info, _( "A training session with this book takes %s." ),
787  to_string_clipped( reading->time ) );
788  } else {
789  add_msg( m_info, _( "A chapter of this book takes %s to read." ),
790  to_string_clipped( reading->time ) );
791  }
792 
793  std::vector<std::string> crafting_recipes;
794  std::vector<std::string> practice_recipes;
795  for( const islot_book::recipe_with_description_t &elem : reading->recipes ) {
796  // If the player knows it, they recognize it even if it's not clearly stated.
797  if( elem.is_hidden() && !knows_recipe( elem.recipe ) ) {
798  continue;
799  }
800  if( elem.recipe->is_practice() ) {
801  practice_recipes.emplace_back( elem.recipe->result_name() );
802  } else {
803  crafting_recipes.emplace_back( elem.name() );
804  }
805  }
806  if( !crafting_recipes.empty() ) {
807  add_msg( m_info, string_format( _( "This book can help you craft: %s" ),
808  enumerate_as_string( crafting_recipes ) ) );
809  }
810  if( !practice_recipes.empty() ) {
811  add_msg( m_info, string_format( _( "This book can help you practice: %s" ),
812  enumerate_as_string( practice_recipes ) ) );
813  }
814  const std::size_t num_total_recipes = crafting_recipes.size() + practice_recipes.size();
815  if( num_total_recipes < reading->recipes.size() ) {
816  add_msg( m_info, _( "It might help you figuring out some more recipes." ) );
817  }
818 }

◆ invoke_item() [7/8]

bool avatar::invoke_item ( item *  ,
const tripoint &  pt,
int  pre_obtain_moves 
)
overridevirtual

Asks how to use the item (if it has more than one use_method) and uses it.

Returns true if it destroys the item. Consumes charges from the item. Multi-use items are ONLY supported when all use_methods are iuse_actor!

Reimplemented from Character.

Definition at line 1482 of file avatar.cpp.

1483 {
1484  const std::map<std::string, use_function> &use_methods = used->type->use_methods;
1485  const int num_methods = use_methods.size();
1486 
1487  const bool has_relic = used->has_relic_activation();
1488  if( use_methods.empty() && !has_relic ) {
1489  return false;
1490  } else if( num_methods == 1 && !has_relic ) {
1491  return invoke_item( used, use_methods.begin()->first, pt, pre_obtain_moves );
1492  } else if( num_methods == 0 && has_relic ) {
1493  return used->use_relic( *this, pt );
1494  }
1495

1497

1499  umenu.hilight_disabled = true;
1500

1502  const auto res = e.second.can_call( *this, *used, pt );
1503  umenu.addentry_desc( MENU_AUTOASSIGN, res.success(), MENU_AUTOASSIGN, e.second.get_name(),
1504  res.str() );
1505  }
1506  if( has_relic ) {
1507  umenu.addentry_desc( MENU_AUTOASSIGN, true, MENU_AUTOASSIGN, _( "Use relic" ),
1508  _( "Activate this relic." ) );
1509  }
1510

1512  umenu.entries.end(), []( const uilist_entry & elem ) {
1513  return !elem.desc.empty();
1514  } );
1515 
1516  umenu.query();
1517 
1518  int choice = umenu.ret;
1519  // Use the relic
1520  if( choice == num_methods ) {
1521  return used->use_relic( *this, pt );
1522  }
1523  if( choice < 0 || choice >= num_methods ) {
1524  return false;
1525  }

1619  // TEMPORARY until 0.G
1620  if( !data.has_member( "location" ) ) {
1621  set_location( get_map().getglobal( read_legacy_creature_pos( data ) ) );
1622  }
1623 
1624  // TEMPORARY until 0.G
1625  if( !data.has_member( "kill_xp" ) ) {
1626  kill_xp = g->get_kill_tracker().legacy_kill_xp();
1627  }
1628 
1629  // Remove after 0.F
1630  // Exists to prevent failed to visit member errors
1631  if( data.has_member( "reactor_plut" ) ) {
1632  data.get_int( "reactor_plut" );
1633  }
1634  if( data.has_member( "tank_plut" ) ) {
1635  data.get_int( "tank_plut" );
1636  }
1637 
1638  std::string prof_ident = "(null)";
1639  if( data.read( "profession", prof_ident ) && string_id<profession>( prof_ident ).is_valid() ) {
1640  prof = &string_id<profession>( prof_ident ).obj();
1641  } else {
1642  //We are likely an older profession which has since been removed so just set to default. This is only cosmetic after game start.
1643  prof = profession::generic();
1644  }
1645 
1646  std::vector<string_id<profession>> hobby_ids;
1647  data.read( "hobbies", hobby_ids );
1648  for( const profession_id &hobby : hobby_ids ) {
1649  hobbies.insert( hobbies.end(), &hobby.obj() );
1650  }
1651 
1652  data.read( "followers", follower_ids );
1653  if( data.has_member( "shadow_npc" ) ) {
1654  shadow_npc = std::make_unique<npc>();
1655  data.read( "shadow_npc", *shadow_npc );
1656  }
1657  data.read( "controlling_vehicle", controlling_vehicle );
1658 
1659  data.read( "grab_point", grab_point );
1660  std::string grab_typestr = "OBJECT_NONE";
1661  if( grab_point.x != 0 || grab_point.y != 0 ) {
1662  grab_typestr = "OBJECT_VEHICLE";
1663  data.read( "grab_type", grab_typestr );
1664  } else {
1665  // we just want to read, but ignore grab_type
1666  std::string fake;
1667  data.read( "grab_type", fake );
1668  }
1669 
1670  // On Visual Studio array iterators are not pointers, so prevent clang-tidy
1671  // from converting this to a pointer type.
1672  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(readability-qualified-auto)
1673  const auto iter = std::find( obj_type_name.begin(), obj_type_name.end(), grab_typestr );
1674  grab( iter == obj_type_name.end() ?
1675  object_type::NONE : static_cast<object_type>(
1676  std::distance( obj_type_name.begin(), iter ) ),
1677  grab_point );
1678 
1679  data.read( "magic", magic );
1680 
1681  calc_mutation_levels();
1682  drench_mut_calc();
1683  std::string scen_ident = "(null)";
1684  if( data.read( "scenario", scen_ident ) && string_id<scenario>( scen_ident ).is_valid() ) {
1685  set_scenario( &string_id<scenario>( scen_ident ).obj() );
1686 
1687  if( !get_scenario()->allowed_start( start_location ) ) {
1688  start_location = get_scenario()->random_start_location();
1689  }
1690  } else {
1691  const scenario *generic_scenario = scenario::generic();
1692 
1693  debugmsg( "Tried to use non-existent scenario '%s'. Setting to generic '%s'.",
1694  scen_ident.c_str(), generic_scenario->ident().c_str() );
1695  set_scenario( generic_scenario );
1696  }
1697 
1698  data.read( "learned_recipes", *learned_recipes );
1699  valid_autolearn_skills->clear(); // Invalidates the cache
1700 
1701  items_identified.clear();
1702  data.read( "items_identified", items_identified );
1703 
1704  data.read( "translocators", translocators );
1705 
1706  std::vector<int> tmpmissions;
1707  if( data.read( "active_missions", tmpmissions ) ) {
1708  active_missions = mission::to_ptr_vector( tmpmissions );
1709  }
1710  if( data.read( "failed_missions", tmpmissions ) ) {
1711  failed_missions = mission::to_ptr_vector( tmpmissions );
1712  }
1713  if( data.read( "completed_missions", tmpmissions ) ) {
1714  completed_missions = mission::to_ptr_vector( tmpmissions );
1715  }
1716 
1717  int tmpactive_mission = 0;
1718  if( data.read( "active_mission", tmpactive_mission ) ) {
1719  if( tmpactive_mission != -1 ) {
1720  active_mission = mission::find( tmpactive_mission );
1721  }
1722  }
1723 
1724  // Normally there is only one player character loaded, so if a mission that is assigned to
1725  // another character (not the current one) fails, the other character(s) are not informed.
1726  // We must inform them when they get loaded the next time.
1727  // Only active missions need checking, failed/complete will not change anymore.
1728  const auto last = std::remove_if( active_missions.begin(),
1729  active_missions.end(), []( mission const * m ) {
1730  return m->has_failed();
1731  } );
1732  std::copy( last, active_missions.end(), std::back_inserter( failed_missions ) );
1733  active_missions.erase( last, active_missions.end() );
1734  if( active_mission && active_mission->has_failed() ) {
1735  if( active_missions.empty() ) {
1736  active_mission = nullptr;
1737  } else {
1738  active_mission = active_missions.front();
1739  }
1740  }
1741 
1742  data.read( "show_map_memory", show_map_memory );
1743 
1744  for( JsonArray pair : data.get_array( "assigned_invlet" ) ) {
1745  inv->assigned_invlet[static_cast<char>( pair.get_int( 0 ) )] =
1746  itype_id( pair.get_string( 1 ) );
1747  }
1748 
1749  if( data.has_member( "invcache" ) ) {
1750  inv->json_load_invcache( data.get_member( "invcache" ) );
1751  }
1752 
1753  data.read( "calorie_diary", calorie_diary );
1754 
1755  data.read( "preferred_aiming_mode", preferred_aiming_mode );
1756 
1757  if( data.has_member( "power_prev_turn" ) ) {
1758  data.read( "power_prev_turn", power_prev_turn );
1759  }

◆ on_mission_finished()

void avatar::on_mission_finished ( mission &  cur_mission)

Called when a mission has been completed or failed.

Either way it's finished. Check mission::has_failed to see which case it is.

Definition at line 364 of file avatar.cpp.

365 {
366  if( cur_mission.has_failed() ) {
367  if( !cur_mission.get_type().invisible_on_complete ) {
368  failed_missions.push_back( &cur_mission );
369  }
370  add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "Mission \"%s\" is failed." ), cur_mission.name() );
371  } else {
372  if( !cur_mission.get_type().invisible_on_complete ) {
373  completed_missions.push_back( &cur_mission );
374  }
375  add_msg_if_player( m_good, _( "Mission \"%s\" is successfully completed." ),
376  cur_mission.name() );

378  const auto iter = std::find( active_missions.begin(), active_missions.end(), &cur_mission );
379  if( iter == active_missions.end() ) {
380  debugmsg( "completed mission %s was not in the active_missions list",
381  cur_mission.mission_id().c_str() );
382  } else {
383  active_missions.erase( iter );

◆ power_bionics()

void avatar::power_bionics ( )
overridevirtual

Generates and handles the UI for player interaction with installed bionics.

Total required height is: top frame line: + 1 height of title window: + TITLE_HEIGHT height of tabs: + TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT height of the biggest list of active/passive bionics: + bionic_count bottom frame line: + 1 TOTAL: TITLE_HEIGHT + TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT + bionic_count + 2

Reimplemented from Character.

Definition at line 574 of file bionics_ui.cpp.

575 {
576  sorted_bionics passive = filtered_bionics( *my_bionics, TAB_PASSIVE );
577  sorted_bionics active = filtered_bionics( *my_bionics, TAB_ACTIVE );
578  bionic *bio_last = nullptr;
579  bionic_tab_mode tab_mode = TAB_ACTIVE;
580 
581  //added title_tab_height for the tabbed bionic display
582  const int TITLE_HEIGHT = 4;
583  const int TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT = 3;
584  int HEIGHT = 0;
585  int WIDTH = 0;
586  int LIST_HEIGHT = 0;
587  int list_start_y = 0;
588  int half_list_view_location = 0;
589  catacurses::window wBio;
590  catacurses::window w_description;
591  catacurses::window w_title;
592  catacurses::window w_tabs;
593 
594  bool hide = false;
595  ui_adaptor ui;
596  ui.on_screen_resize( [&]( ui_adaptor & ui ) {
597  if( hide ) {
598  ui.position( point_zero, point_zero );
599  return;
600  }
601  // Main window
602  /** Total required height is:
603  * top frame line: + 1
604  * height of title window: + TITLE_HEIGHT
605  * height of tabs: + TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT
606  * height of the biggest list of active/passive bionics: + bionic_count
607  * bottom frame line: + 1
608  * TOTAL: TITLE_HEIGHT + TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT + bionic_count + 2
609  */
610  HEIGHT = std::min( TERMY,
611  std::max( FULL_SCREEN_HEIGHT,
612  TITLE_HEIGHT + TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT +
613  static_cast<int>( my_bionics->size() ) + 2 ) );
614  WIDTH = FULL_SCREEN_WIDTH + ( TERMX - FULL_SCREEN_WIDTH ) / 2;
615  const point START( ( TERMX - WIDTH ) / 2, ( TERMY - HEIGHT ) / 2 );
616  //wBio is the entire bionic window
617  wBio = catacurses::newwin( HEIGHT, WIDTH, START );
618 
619  LIST_HEIGHT = HEIGHT - TITLE_HEIGHT - TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT - 2;
620 
621  const int DESCRIPTION_WIDTH = WIDTH - 2 - 40;
622  const int DESCRIPTION_START_Y = START.y + TITLE_HEIGHT + TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT + 1;
623  const int DESCRIPTION_START_X = START.x + 1 + 40;
624  //w_description is the description panel that is controlled with ! key
625  w_description = catacurses::newwin( LIST_HEIGHT, DESCRIPTION_WIDTH,
626  point( DESCRIPTION_START_X, DESCRIPTION_START_Y ) );
627 
628  // Title window
629  const int TITLE_START_Y = START.y + 1;
630  const int HEADER_LINE_Y = TITLE_HEIGHT + TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT;
631  w_title = catacurses::newwin( TITLE_HEIGHT, WIDTH - 2, START + point_east );
632 
633  const int TAB_START_Y = TITLE_START_Y + 3;
634  //w_tabs is the tab bar for passive and active bionic groups
635  w_tabs = catacurses::newwin( TITLE_TAB_HEIGHT, WIDTH,
636  point( START.x, TAB_START_Y ) );
637 
638  // offset for display: bionic with index i is drawn at y=list_start_y+i
639  // drawing the bionics starts with bionic[scroll_position]
640  // scroll_position;
641  list_start_y = HEADER_LINE_Y;
642  half_list_view_location = LIST_HEIGHT / 2;
643 
644  ui.position_from_window( wBio );
645  } );
646  ui.mark_resize();
647 
648  int scroll_position = 0;
649  int cursor = 0;
650 
651  //generate the tab title string and a count of the bionics owned
652  bionic_menu_mode menu_mode = ACTIVATING;
653  int max_scroll_position = 0;
654 
655  input_context ctxt( "BIONICS", keyboard_mode::keychar );
656  ctxt.register_updown();
657  ctxt.register_action( "ANY_INPUT" );
658  ctxt.register_action( "TOGGLE_EXAMINE" );
659  ctxt.register_action( "REASSIGN" );
660  ctxt.register_action( "NEXT_TAB" );
661  ctxt.register_action( "PREV_TAB" );
662  ctxt.register_action( "CONFIRM" );
663  ctxt.register_action( "QUIT" );
664  ctxt.register_action( "HELP_KEYBINDINGS" );
665  ctxt.register_action( "TOGGLE_SAFE_FUEL" );
666  ctxt.register_action( "TOGGLE_SPRITE" );
667  ctxt.register_action( "SORT" );
668 
669  ui.on_redraw( [&]( const ui_adaptor & ) {
670  if( hide ) {
671  return;
672  }
673 
674  sorted_bionics *current_bionic_list = tab_mode == TAB_ACTIVE ? &active : &passive;
675 
676  werase( wBio );
677  draw_border( wBio, BORDER_COLOR, _( " BIONICS " ) );
678  mvwputch( wBio, point( getmaxx( wBio ) - 1, 2 ), BORDER_COLOR, LINE_XOXX ); // -|
679 
680  int max_width = 0;
681  std::vector<std::string> bps;
682  std::map<bodypart_str_id, size_t> bp_to_pos;
683  for( const bodypart_id &bp : get_all_body_parts() ) {
684  const int total = get_total_bionics_slots( bp );
685  const std::string s = string_format( "%s: %d/%d",
686  body_part_name_as_heading( bp, 1 ),
687  total - get_free_bionics_slots( bp ), total );
688  bps.push_back( s );
689  bp_to_pos.emplace( bp.id(), bps.size() - 1 );
690  max_width = std::max( max_width, utf8_width( s ) );
691  }
692  const int pos_x = WIDTH - 2 - max_width;
693  if( get_option < bool >( "CBM_SLOTS_ENABLED" ) ) {
694  for( size_t i = 0; i < bps.size(); ++i ) {
695  mvwprintz( wBio, point( pos_x, i + list_start_y ), c_light_gray, bps[i] );
696  }
697  }
698 
699  if( current_bionic_list->empty() ) {
700  std::string msg;
701  switch( tab_mode ) {
702  case TAB_ACTIVE:
703  msg = _( "No activatable bionics installed." );
704  break;
705  case TAB_PASSIVE:
706  msg = _( "No passive bionics installed." );
707  break;
708  }
709  fold_and_print( wBio, point( 2, list_start_y ), pos_x - 1, c_light_gray, msg );
710  } else {
711  for( size_t i = scroll_position; i < current_bionic_list->size(); i++ ) {
712  if( list_start_y + static_cast<int>( i ) - scroll_position == HEIGHT - 1 ) {
713  break;
714  }
715  const bool is_highlighted = cursor == static_cast<int>( i );
716  const nc_color col = get_bionic_text_color( *( *current_bionic_list )[i],
717  is_highlighted );
718  const std::string desc = string_format( "%c %s", ( *current_bionic_list )[i]->invlet,
719  build_bionic_powerdesc_string(
720  *( *current_bionic_list )[i], this ).c_str() );
721  trim_and_print( wBio, point( 2, list_start_y + i - scroll_position ), WIDTH - 3, col,
722  desc );
723  if( is_highlighted && menu_mode != EXAMINING && get_option < bool >( "CBM_SLOTS_ENABLED" ) ) {
724  const bionic_id bio_id = ( *current_bionic_list )[i]->id;
725  draw_connectors( wBio, point( utf8_width( desc ) + 3, list_start_y + i - scroll_position ),
726  pos_x - 2, bio_id, bp_to_pos );
727 
728  // redraw highlighted (occupied) body parts
729  for( const std::pair<const string_id<body_part_type>, size_t> &elem : bio_id->occupied_bodyparts ) {
730  const int i = bp_to_pos[elem.first];
731  mvwprintz( wBio, point( pos_x, i + list_start_y ), c_yellow, bps[i] );
732  }
733  }
734 
735  }
736  }
737 
738  draw_scrollbar( wBio, cursor, LIST_HEIGHT, current_bionic_list->size(), point( 0, list_start_y ) );
739 
740  wnoutrefresh( wBio );
741  draw_bionics_tabs( w_tabs, active.size(), passive.size(), tab_mode );
742 
743  draw_bionics_titlebar( w_title, this, menu_mode );
744  if( menu_mode == EXAMINING && !current_bionic_list->empty() ) {
745  draw_description( w_description, *( *current_bionic_list )[cursor], get_all_body_parts().size(),
746  this );
747  }
748  } );
749 
750  for( ;; ) {
751  ui_manager::redraw();
752 
753  //track which list we are looking at
754  ::sorted_bionics *current_bionic_list = tab_mode == TAB_ACTIVE ? &active : &passive;
755  max_scroll_position = std::max( 0, static_cast<int>( current_bionic_list->size() ) - LIST_HEIGHT );
756  scroll_position = clamp( scroll_position, 0, max_scroll_position );
757  cursor = clamp<int>( cursor, 0, current_bionic_list->size() );
758 
759 #if defined(__ANDROID__)
760  ctxt.get_registered_manual_keys().clear();
761  for( size_t i = 0; i < current_bionic_list->size(); i++ ) {
762  ctxt.register_manual_key( ( *current_bionic_list )[i]->invlet,
763  build_bionic_powerdesc_string( *( *current_bionic_list )[i], this ) );
764  }
765 #endif
766 
767  const std::string action = ctxt.handle_input();
768  const int ch = ctxt.get_raw_input().get_first_input();
769  bionic *tmp = nullptr;
770 
771  if( action == "DOWN" ) {
772  if( static_cast<size_t>( cursor ) < current_bionic_list->size() - 1 ) {
773  cursor++;
774  } else {
775  cursor = 0;
776  }
777  if( scroll_position < max_scroll_position &&
778  cursor - scroll_position > LIST_HEIGHT - half_list_view_location ) {
779  scroll_position++;
780  }
781  if( scroll_position > 0 && cursor - scroll_position < half_list_view_location ) {
782  scroll_position = std::max( cursor - half_list_view_location, 0 );
783  }
784  } else if( action == "UP" ) {
785  if( cursor > 0 ) {
786  cursor--;
787  } else {
788  cursor = current_bionic_list->size() - 1;
789  }
790  if( scroll_position > 0 && cursor - scroll_position < half_list_view_location ) {
791  scroll_position--;
792  }
793  if( scroll_position < max_scroll_position &&
794  cursor - scroll_position > LIST_HEIGHT - half_list_view_location ) {
795  scroll_position =
796  std::max( std::min<int>( current_bionic_list->size() - LIST_HEIGHT,
797  cursor - half_list_view_location ), 0 );
798  }
799  } else if( menu_mode == REASSIGNING ) {
800  menu_mode = ACTIVATING;
801 
802  if( action == "CONFIRM" && !current_bionic_list->empty() ) {
803  sorted_bionics &bio_list = tab_mode == TAB_ACTIVE ? active : passive;
804  tmp = bio_list[cursor];
805  } else {
806  tmp = bionic_by_invlet( ch );
807  }
808 
809  if( tmp == nullptr ) {
810  // Selected an non-existing bionic (or Escape, or ...)
811  continue;
812  }
813  const int newch = popup_getkey( _( "%s; enter new letter. Space to clear. Esc to cancel." ),
814  tmp->id->name );
815  if( newch == ch || newch == KEY_ESCAPE ) {
816  continue;
817  }
818  if( newch == ' ' ) {
819  tmp->invlet = ' ';
820  continue;
821  }
822  if( !bionic_chars.valid( newch ) ) {
823  popup( _( "Invalid bionic letter. Only those characters are valid:\n\n%s" ),
824  bionic_chars.get_allowed_chars() );
825  continue;
826  }
827  bionic *otmp = bionic_by_invlet( newch );
828  if( otmp != nullptr ) {
829  std::swap( tmp->invlet, otmp->invlet );
830  } else {
831  tmp->invlet = newch;
832  }
833  // TODO: show a message like when reassigning a key to an item?
834  } else if( action == "NEXT_TAB" ) {
835  scroll_position = 0;
836  cursor = 0;
837  if( tab_mode == TAB_ACTIVE ) {
838  tab_mode = TAB_PASSIVE;
839  } else {
840  tab_mode = TAB_ACTIVE;
841  }
842  } else if( action == "PREV_TAB" ) {
843  scroll_position = 0;
844  cursor = 0;
845  if( tab_mode == TAB_PASSIVE ) {
846  tab_mode = TAB_ACTIVE;
847  } else {
848  tab_mode = TAB_PASSIVE;
849  }
850  } else if( action == "REASSIGN" ) {
851  menu_mode = REASSIGNING;
852  } else if( action == "TOGGLE_EXAMINE" ) {
853  // switches between activation and examination
854  menu_mode = menu_mode == ACTIVATING ? EXAMINING : ACTIVATING;
855  } else if( action == "TOGGLE_SAFE_FUEL" ) {
856  sorted_bionics &bio_list = tab_mode == TAB_ACTIVE ? active : passive;
857  if( !current_bionic_list->empty() ) {
858  tmp = bio_list[cursor];
859  if( !tmp->info().fuel_opts.empty() || tmp->info().is_remote_fueled ) {
860  tmp->toggle_safe_fuel_mod();
861  g->invalidate_main_ui_adaptor();
862  } else {
863  popup( _( "You can't toggle fuel saving mode on a non-fueled CBM." ) );
864  }
865  }
866  } else if( action == "TOGGLE_SPRITE" ) {
867  sorted_bionics &bio_list = tab_mode == TAB_ACTIVE ? active : passive;
868  if( !current_bionic_list->empty() ) {
869  tmp = bio_list[cursor];
870  tmp->show_sprite = !tmp->show_sprite;
871  }
872  } else if( action == "SORT" ) {
873  uistate.bionic_sort_mode = pick_sort_mode();
874  // FIXME: is there a better way to resort?
875  active = filtered_bionics( *my_bionics, TAB_ACTIVE );
876  passive = filtered_bionics( *my_bionics, TAB_PASSIVE );
877  } else if( action == "CONFIRM" || action == "ANY_INPUT" ) {
878  sorted_bionics &bio_list = tab_mode == TAB_ACTIVE ? active : passive;
879  if( action == "CONFIRM" && !current_bionic_list->empty() ) {
880  tmp = bio_list[cursor];
881  } else {
882  tmp = bionic_by_invlet( ch );
883  if( tmp && tmp != bio_last ) {
884  // new bionic selected, update cursor and scroll position
885  int temp_cursor = 0;
886  for( temp_cursor = 0; temp_cursor < static_cast<int>( bio_list.size() ); temp_cursor++ ) {
887  if( bio_list[temp_cursor] == tmp ) {
888  break;
889  }
890  }
891  // if bionic is not found in current list, ignore the attempt to view/activate
892  if( temp_cursor >= static_cast<int>( bio_list.size() ) ) {
893  continue;
894  }
895  //relocate cursor to the bionic that was found
896  cursor = temp_cursor;
897  scroll_position = 0;
898  while( scroll_position < max_scroll_position &&
899  cursor - scroll_position > LIST_HEIGHT - half_list_view_location ) {
900  scroll_position++;
901  }
902  }
903  }
904  if( !tmp ) {
905  // entered a key that is not mapped to any bionic
906  continue;
907  }
908  bio_last = tmp;
909  const bionic_id &bio_id = tmp->id;
910  const bionic_data &bio_data = bio_id.obj();
911  if( menu_mode == ACTIVATING ) {
912  if( bio_data.activated ) {
913  int b = tmp - my_bionics->data();
914  bionic &bio = ( *my_bionics )[b];
915  hide = true;
916  ui.mark_resize();
917  if( tmp->powered ) {
918  deactivate_bionic( bio );
919  if( bio_data.deactivated_close_ui ) {
920  ui.reset();
921  break;
922  }
923  } else {
924  bool activate = true;
925 
926  if( bio.can_install_weapon() ) {
927  const bool has_weapon = bio.has_weapon();
928  activate = false;
929 
930  uilist activate_action_menu;
931  activate_action_menu.title = _( "Select action" );
932  activate_action_menu.addentry( 0, has_weapon, 'a', _( "Activate" ) );
933  activate_action_menu.addentry( 1, has_weapon, 'u', _( "Uninstall weapon" ) );
934  activate_action_menu.addentry( 2, !has_weapon, 'i', _( "Install weapon" ) );
935 
936  activate_action_menu.query();
937 
938  switch( activate_action_menu.ret ) {
939  case 0:
940  activate = true;
941  break;
942  case 1:
943  // TODO: Move to function, create activity and add tool requirements
944  if( std::optional<item> weapon = bio.uninstall_weapon() ) {
945  i_add_or_drop( *weapon );
946  }
947  break;
948  case 2: {
949  // TODO: Move to activity, create activity, add tool requirements, improve UI
950  uilist install_weapon_menu;
951  install_weapon_menu.title = _( "Select weapon to install" );
952  // TODO: Choose from items around, obtain items before installing
953  std::vector<item *> valid_weapons = items_with( [&bio]( const item & it ) {
954  return it.has_any_flag( bio.id->installable_weapon_flags );
955  } );
956  for( size_t i = 0; i < valid_weapons.size(); i++ ) {
957  install_weapon_menu.addentry( i, true, MENU_AUTOASSIGN, valid_weapons[i]->tname() );
958  }
959  if( install_weapon_menu.entries.empty() ) {
960  popup( _( "You don't have any items you can install in this bionic" ) );
961  } else {
962  install_weapon_menu.query();
963  if( install_weapon_menu.ret >= 0 &&
964  static_cast<size_t>( install_weapon_menu.ret ) < valid_weapons.size() ) {
965  item &new_weapon = *valid_weapons[install_weapon_menu.ret];
966  if( bio.can_install_weapon( new_weapon ) && bio.install_weapon( new_weapon ) ) {
967  item_location loc( *this, &new_weapon );
968  loc.remove_item();
969  } else {
970  popup( _( "Unable to install %s" ), new_weapon.tname() );
971  }
972  }
973  }
974  break;
975  }
976  default:
977  break;
978  }
979  }
980 
981  if( activate ) {
982  bool close_ui = false;
983  if( bio_data.activated_close_ui ) {
984  ui.reset();
985  activate_bionic( bio, false, &close_ui );
986  break;
987  } else {
988  activate_bionic( bio, false, &close_ui );
989  // Exit this ui if we are firing a complex bionic
990  if( close_ui && tmp->get_weapon().shots_remaining( this ) > 0 ) {
991  break;
992  }
993  }
994  }
995  }
996  hide = false;
997  ui.mark_resize();
998  g->invalidate_main_ui_adaptor();
999  if( moves < 0 ) {
1000  return;
1001  }
1002  continue;
1003  } else {
1004  popup( _( "You can not activate %s!\n"
1005  "To read a description of %s, press '%s', then '%c'." ), bio_data.name,
1006  bio_data.name, ctxt.get_desc( "TOGGLE_EXAMINE" ), tmp->invlet );
1007  }
1008  } else if( menu_mode == EXAMINING ) {
1009  // Describing bionics, allow user to jump to description key
1010  if( action != "CONFIRM" ) {
1011  for( size_t i = 0; i < active.size(); i++ ) {
1012  if( active[i] == tmp ) {
1013  tab_mode = TAB_ACTIVE;
1014  cursor = static_cast<int>( i );
1015  int max_scroll_check = std::max( 0, static_cast<int>( active.size() ) - LIST_HEIGHT );
1016  if( static_cast<int>( i ) > max_scroll_check ) {
1017  scroll_position = max_scroll_check;
1018  } else {
1019  scroll_position = i;
1020  }
1021  break;
1022  }
1023  }
1024  for( size_t i = 0; i < passive.size(); i++ ) {
1025  if( passive[i] == tmp ) {
1026  tab_mode = TAB_PASSIVE;
1027  cursor = static_cast<int>( i );
1028  int max_scroll_check = std::max( 0, static_cast<int>( passive.size() ) - LIST_HEIGHT );
1029  if( static_cast<int>( i ) > max_scroll_check ) {
1030  scroll_position = max_scroll_check;
1031  } else {
1032  scroll_position = i;
1033  }
1034  break;
1035  }
1036  }
1037  }
1038  }
1039  } else if( action == "QUIT" ) {
1040  break;
1041  }
1042  }
1043 }
get_bionic_text_color

base_camps::tab_mode
tab_mode
Definition: basecamp.h:75
om_direction::size

Definition: omdata.h:66
tname
Definition: item_tname.cpp:613
draw_scrollbar
void draw_scrollbar(const catacurses::window &window, const int iCurrentLine, const int iContentHeight, const int iNumLines, const point &offset, nc_color bar_color, const bool bDoNotScrollToEnd)

Definition: output.cpp:1704
popup_getkey
int popup_getkey(const char *const mes, Args &&... args)
Definition: output.h:482
point_zero
constexpr point point_zero
Definition: point.h:251
point_east
constexpr point point_east
Definition: point.h:255
bionic_data
Definition: bionics.h:33
bionic_data::activated_close_ui
bool activated_close_ui
whether to immediately close ui when activating - used for targeted bionics
Definition: bionics.h:172
bionic_data::name

Definition: bionics.h:141
bionic_data::activated
bool activated

Definition: bionics.h:160
bionic_data::installable_weapon_flags
std::set< json_character_flag > installable_weapon_flags
Definition: bionics.h:120
bionic_data::occupied_bodyparts
std::map< bodypart_str_id, size_t > occupied_bodyparts

◆ power_mutations()

void avatar::power_mutations ( )
overridevirtual

Total required height is: top frame line: + 1 height of title window: + TITLE_HEIGHT line after the title: + 1 line with active/passive mutation captions: + 1 height of the biggest list of active/passive mutations: + mutations_count line before mutation description: + 1 height of description window: + DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT bottom frame line: + 1 TOTAL: TITLE_HEIGHT + mutations_count + DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT + 5

Reimplemented from Character.

Definition at line 97 of file mutation_ui.cpp.

98 {
99  std::vector<trait_id> passive;
100  std::vector<trait_id> active;
101  for( std::pair<const trait_id, trait_data> &mut : my_mutations ) {
102  if( !mut.first->player_display ) {
103  continue;
104  }
105  if( !mut.first->activated ) {
106  passive.push_back( mut.first );
107  } else {
108  active.push_back( mut.first );
109  }
110  // New mutations are initialized with no key at all, so we have to do this here.
111  if( mut.second.key == ' ' ) {
112  for( const char &letter : mutation_chars ) {
113  if( trait_by_invlet( letter ).is_null() ) {
114  mut.second.key = letter;
115  break;
116  }
117  }
118  }
119  }
120 
121  // maximal number of rows in both columns
122  const int mutations_count = std::max( passive.size(), active.size() );
123  const int TITLE_HEIGHT = 2;
124 
125  const int DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT = 5;
126  // + lines with text in titlebar, local
127  const int HEADER_LINE_Y = TITLE_HEIGHT + 1;
128  const int list_start_y = HEADER_LINE_Y + 2;
129 
130  // Main window
131  /** Total required height is:
132  * top frame line: + 1
133  * height of title window: + TITLE_HEIGHT
134  * line after the title: + 1
135  * line with active/passive mutation captions: + 1
136  * height of the biggest list of active/passive mutations: + mutations_count
137  * line before mutation description: + 1
138  * height of description window: + DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT
139  * bottom frame line: + 1
140  * TOTAL: TITLE_HEIGHT + mutations_count + DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT + 5
141  */
142 
143  int HEIGHT = 0;
144  int WIDTH = 0;
145  catacurses::window wBio;
146 
147  int DESCRIPTION_LINE_Y = 0;
148  catacurses::window w_description;
149 
150  catacurses::window w_title;
151 
152  int second_column = 0;
153 
154  int scroll_position = 0;
155  int examine_pos = 0;
156  int cursor = 0;
157  int max_scroll_position = 0;
158  int list_height = 0;
159  int half_list_view_location = 0;
160  mutation_menu_mode menu_mode = mutation_menu_mode::activating;
161  mutation_tab_mode tab_mode;
162  if( !active.empty() ) {
163  tab_mode = mutation_tab_mode::active;
164  } else if( !passive.empty() ) {
165  tab_mode = mutation_tab_mode::passive;
166  } else {
167  tab_mode = mutation_tab_mode::none;
168  }
169 
170  const auto recalc_max_scroll_position = [&]() {
171  list_height = ( menu_mode == mutation_menu_mode::examining ?
172  DESCRIPTION_LINE_Y : HEIGHT - 1 ) - list_start_y;
173  max_scroll_position = mutations_count - list_height;
174  half_list_view_location = list_height / 2;
175  if( max_scroll_position < 0 ) {
176  scroll_position = 0;
177  } else if( scroll_position > max_scroll_position ) {
178  scroll_position = max_scroll_position;
179  }
180  };
181 
182  ui_adaptor ui;
183  ui.on_screen_resize( [&]( ui_adaptor & ui ) {
184  HEIGHT = std::min( TERMY, std::max( FULL_SCREEN_HEIGHT,
185  TITLE_HEIGHT + mutations_count + DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT + 5 ) );
186  WIDTH = FULL_SCREEN_WIDTH + ( TERMX - FULL_SCREEN_WIDTH ) / 2;
187  const point START( ( TERMX - WIDTH ) / 2, ( TERMY - HEIGHT ) / 2 );
188  wBio = catacurses::newwin( HEIGHT, WIDTH, START );
189 
190  // Description window @ the bottom of the bionic window
191  const int DESCRIPTION_START_Y = START.y + HEIGHT - DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT - 1;
192  DESCRIPTION_LINE_Y = DESCRIPTION_START_Y - START.y - 1;
193  w_description = catacurses::newwin( DESCRIPTION_HEIGHT, WIDTH - 2,
194  point( START.x + 1, DESCRIPTION_START_Y ) );

202  examine_pos = 0;
203 
204  // X-coordinate of the list of active mutations
205  second_column = 32 + ( TERMX - FULL_SCREEN_WIDTH ) / 4;
206 
207  ui.position_from_window( wBio );
208  } );
209  ui.mark_resize();

211  input_context ctxt( "MUTATIONS", keyboard_mode::keychar );
212  ctxt.register_updown();
213  ctxt.register_action( "ANY_INPUT" );
214  ctxt.register_action( "TOGGLE_EXAMINE" );

222  ctxt.register_action( "HELP_KEYBINDINGS" );
223  ctxt.register_action( "QUIT" );
224 #if defined(__ANDROID__)
225  for( const auto &p : passive ) {
226  ctxt.register_manual_key( my_mutations[p].key, p.obj().name() );
227  }
228  for( const auto &a : active ) {
229  ctxt.register_manual_key( my_mutations[a].key, a.obj().name() );
230  }
231 #endif
232 
233  std::optional<trait_id> examine_id;
234 
235  ui.on_redraw( [&]( const ui_adaptor & ) {
236  werase( wBio );
237  draw_border( wBio, BORDER_COLOR, _( "Mutations" ) );
238  // Draw line under title
239  mvwhline( wBio, point( 1, HEADER_LINE_Y ), LINE_OXOX, WIDTH - 2 );
240  // Draw symbols to connect additional lines to border
241  mvwputch( wBio, point( 0, HEADER_LINE_Y ), BORDER_COLOR, LINE_XXXO ); // |-
242  mvwputch( wBio, point( WIDTH - 1, HEADER_LINE_Y ), BORDER_COLOR, LINE_XOXX ); // -|
243 
244  // Captions
245  mvwprintz( wBio, point( 2, HEADER_LINE_Y + 1 ), c_light_blue, _( "Passive:" ) );
246  mvwprintz( wBio, point( second_column, HEADER_LINE_Y + 1 ), c_light_blue, _( "Active:" ) );
247 
248  if( menu_mode == mutation_menu_mode::examining ) {
249  draw_exam_window( wBio, DESCRIPTION_LINE_Y );
250  }
251  nc_color type;
252  if( passive.empty() ) {
253  mvwprintz( wBio, point( 2, list_start_y ), c_light_gray, _( "None" ) );
254  } else {
255  for( int i = scroll_position; static_cast<size_t>( i ) < passive.size(); i++ ) {
256  const mutation_branch &md = passive[i].obj();
257  const trait_data &td = my_mutations[passive[i]];
258  const bool is_highlighted = cursor == static_cast<int>( i );
259  if( i - scroll_position == list_height ) {
260  break;
261  }
262  if( is_highlighted && tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::passive ) {
263  type = has_base_trait( passive[i] ) ? c_cyan_yellow : c_light_cyan_yellow;
264  } else {
265  type = has_base_trait( passive[i] ) ? c_cyan : c_light_cyan;
266  }
267  mvwprintz( wBio, point( 2, list_start_y + i - scroll_position ),
268  type, "%c %s", td.key, mutation_name( md.id ) );
269  if( !td.show_sprite ) {
270  //~ Hint: Letter to show which mutation is Hidden in the mutation menu
271  wprintz( wBio, c_cyan, _( " H" ) );
272  }
273  }
274  }
275 
276  if( active.empty() ) {
277  mvwprintz( wBio, point( second_column, list_start_y ), c_light_gray, _( "None" ) );
278  } else {
279  for( int i = scroll_position; static_cast<size_t>( i ) < active.size(); i++ ) {
280  const mutation_branch &md = active[i].obj();
281  const trait_data &td = my_mutations[active[i]];
282  const bool is_highlighted = cursor == static_cast<int>( i );
283  if( i - scroll_position == list_height ) {
284  break;
285  }
286  if( td.powered ) {
287  if( is_highlighted && tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::active ) {
288  type = has_base_trait( active[i] ) ? c_green_yellow : c_light_green_yellow;
289  } else {
290  type = has_base_trait( active[i] ) ? c_green : c_light_green;
291  }
292  } else {
293  if( is_highlighted && tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::active ) {
294  type = has_base_trait( active[i] ) ? c_red_yellow : c_light_red_yellow;
295  } else {
296  type = has_base_trait( active[i] ) ? c_red : c_light_red;
297  }
298  }
299  // TODO: track resource(s) used and specify
300  mvwputch( wBio, point( second_column, list_start_y + i - scroll_position ),
301  type, td.key );
302  std::string mut_desc;
303  std::string resource_unit;
304  int number_of_resource = 0;
305  if( md.hunger ) {
306  resource_unit += _( " kcal" );
307  number_of_resource++;
308  }
309  if( md.thirst ) {
310  if( number_of_resource > 0 ) {
311  //~ Resources consumed by a mutation: "kcal & thirst & sleepiness"
312  resource_unit += _( " &" );
313  }
314  resource_unit += _( " thirst" );
315  number_of_resource++;
316  }
317  if( md.sleepiness ) {
318  if( number_of_resource > 0 ) {
319  //~ Resources consumed by a mutation: "kcal & thirst & sleepiness"
320  resource_unit += _( " &" );
321  }
322  resource_unit += _( " sleepiness" );
323  }
324  mut_desc += mutation_name( md.id );
325  if( md.cost > 0 && md.cooldown > 0_turns ) {
326  mut_desc += string_format( _( " - %d%s / %s" ),
327  md.cost, resource_unit, to_string_clipped( md.cooldown ) );
328  } else if( md.cost > 0 ) {
329  mut_desc += string_format( _( " - %d%s" ), md.cost, resource_unit );
330  } else if( md.cooldown > 0_turns ) {
331  mut_desc += string_format( _( " - %s" ), to_string_clipped( md.cooldown ) );
332  }
333  if( td.powered ) {
334  mut_desc += _( " - Active" );
335  }
336  mvwprintz( wBio, point( second_column + 2, list_start_y + i - scroll_position ),
337  type, mut_desc );
338  }
339  }
340 
341  draw_scrollbar( wBio, scroll_position, list_height, mutations_count,
342  point( 0, list_start_y ), c_white, true );
343 
344  if( menu_mode == mutation_menu_mode::examining && examine_id.has_value() ) {
345  werase( w_description );
346  std::vector<std::string> desc = foldstring( mutation_desc( examine_id.value() ), WIDTH - 2 );
347  const int winh = catacurses::getmaxy( w_description );
348  const bool do_scroll = desc.size() > static_cast<unsigned>( std::abs( winh ) );
349  const int fline = do_scroll ? examine_pos % ( desc.size() + 1 - winh ) : 0;
350  const int lline = do_scroll ? fline + winh : desc.size();
351  for( int i = fline; i < lline; i++ ) {
352  trim_and_print( w_description, point( 0, i - fline ), WIDTH - 2, c_light_blue, desc[i] );
353  }
354  draw_scrollbar( wBio, fline, winh, desc.size(), point( 0, catacurses::getmaxy( wBio ) - winh - 1 ),
355  c_white, true );
356  }
357  wnoutrefresh( wBio );
358  show_mutations_titlebar( w_title, menu_mode, ctxt );
359  if( menu_mode == mutation_menu_mode::examining && examine_id.has_value() ) {
360  wnoutrefresh( w_description );
361  }
362  } );
363 
364  bool exit = false;
365  while( !exit ) {
366  recalc_max_scroll_position();
367  ui_manager::redraw();
368  bool handled = false;
369  const std::string action = ctxt.handle_input();
370  const input_event evt = ctxt.get_raw_input();
371  if( evt.type == input_event_t::keyboard_char && !evt.sequence.empty() ) {
372  const int ch = evt.get_first_input();
373  if( ch == ' ' ) { //skip if space is pressed (space is used as an empty hotkey)
374  continue;
375  }
376  const trait_id mut_id = trait_by_invlet( ch );
377  if( !mut_id.is_null() ) {
378  const mutation_branch &mut_data = mut_id.obj();
379  switch( menu_mode ) {
380  case mutation_menu_mode::reassigning: {
381  query_popup pop;
382  pop.message( _( "%s; enter new letter." ), mutation_name( mut_id ) )
383  .preferred_keyboard_mode( keyboard_mode::keychar )
384  .context( "POPUP_WAIT" )
385  .allow_cancel( true )
386  .allow_anykey( true );
387 
388  bool pop_exit = false;
389  while( !pop_exit ) {
390  const query_popup::result ret = pop.query();
391  bool pop_handled = false;
392  if( ret.evt.type == input_event_t::keyboard_char && !ret.evt.sequence.empty() ) {
393  const int newch = ret.evt.get_first_input();
394  if( mutation_chars.valid( newch ) ) {
395  const trait_id other_mut_id = trait_by_invlet( newch );
396  if( !other_mut_id.is_null() ) {
397  std::swap( my_mutations[mut_id].key, my_mutations[other_mut_id].key );
398  } else {
399  my_mutations[mut_id].key = newch;
400  }
401  pop_exit = true;
402  pop_handled = true;
403  }
404  }
405  if( !pop_handled ) {
406  if( ret.action == "QUIT" ) {
407  pop_exit = true;
408  } else if( ret.action != "HELP_KEYBINDINGS" &&
409  ret.evt.type == input_event_t::keyboard_char ) {
410  popup( _( "Invalid mutation letter. Only those characters are valid:\n\n%s" ),
411  mutation_chars.get_allowed_chars() );
412  }
413  }
414  }
415 
416  menu_mode = mutation_menu_mode::activating;
417  examine_id = std::nullopt;
418  // TODO: show a message like when reassigning a key to an item?
419  break;
420  }
421  case mutation_menu_mode::activating: {
422  if( mut_data.activated ) {
423  if( my_mutations[mut_id].powered ) {
424  add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "You stop using your %s." ), mutation_name( mut_data.id ) );
425  // Reset menu in advance
426  ui.reset();
427  deactivate_mutation( mut_id );
428  // Action done, leave screen
429  exit = true;
430  } else if( ( !mut_data.hunger || get_kcal_percent() >= 0.8f ) &&
431  ( !mut_data.thirst || get_thirst() <= 400 ) &&
432  ( !mut_data.sleepiness || get_sleepiness() <= 400 ) ) {
433  add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "You activate your %s." ), mutation_name( mut_data.id ) );
434  // Reset menu in advance
435  ui.reset();
436  activate_mutation( mut_id );
437  // Action done, leave screen
438  exit = true;
439  } else {
440  popup( _( "You don't have enough in you to activate your %s!" ), mutation_name( mut_data.id ) );
441  }
442  } else {
443  popup( _( "You cannot activate %1$s! To read a description of "
444  "%1$s, press '!', then '%2$c'." ),
445  mutation_name( mut_data.id ), my_mutations[mut_id].key );
446  }
447  break;
448  }
449  case mutation_menu_mode::examining:
450  // Describing mutations, not activating them!
451  examine_id = mut_id;
452  break;
453  case mutation_menu_mode::hiding:
454  my_mutations[mut_id].show_sprite = !my_mutations[mut_id].show_sprite;
455  break;
456  }
457  handled = true;
458  } else if( mutation_chars.valid( ch ) ) {
459  handled = true;
460  }
461  }
462  if( !handled ) {
463 
464  // Essentially, up-down navigation adapted from the bionics_ui.cpp, with a bunch of extra workarounds to keep functionality
465 
466  if( action == "DOWN" ) {
467 
468  int lowerlim;
469 
470  if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::passive ) {
471  lowerlim = static_cast<int>( passive.size() ) - 1;
472  } else if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::active ) {
473  lowerlim = static_cast<int>( active.size() ) - 1;
474  } else {
475  continue;
476  }
477 
478  if( cursor < lowerlim ) {
479  cursor++;
480  } else {
481  cursor = 0;
482  }
483  if( scroll_position < max_scroll_position &&
484  cursor - scroll_position > list_height - half_list_view_location ) {
485  scroll_position++;
486  }
487  if( scroll_position > 0 && cursor - scroll_position < half_list_view_location ) {
488  scroll_position = std::max( cursor - half_list_view_location, 0 );
489  }
490  examine_pos = 0;
491 
492  // Draw the description, shabby workaround
493  examine_id = GetTrait( active, passive, cursor, tab_mode );
494 
495  } else if( action == "UP" ) {
496 
497  int lim;
498  if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::passive ) {
499  lim = passive.size() - 1;
500  } else if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::active ) {
501  lim = active.size() - 1;
502  } else {
503  continue;
504  }
505  if( cursor > 0 ) {
506  cursor--;
507  } else {
508  cursor = lim;
509  }
510  if( scroll_position > 0 && cursor - scroll_position < half_list_view_location ) {
511  scroll_position--;
512  }
513  if( scroll_position < max_scroll_position &&
514  cursor - scroll_position > list_height - half_list_view_location ) {
515  scroll_position =
516  std::max( std::min<int>( lim + 1 - list_height,
517  cursor - half_list_view_location ), 0 );
518  }
519  examine_pos = 0;
520 
521  examine_id = GetTrait( active, passive, cursor, tab_mode );
522  } else if( ( action == "SCROLL_TRAIT_INFO_UP" || action == "SCROLL_TRAIT_INFO_DOWN" ) &&
523  menu_mode == mutation_menu_mode::examining ) {
524  examine_pos += action == "SCROLL_TRAIT_INFO_UP" ? -1 : 1;
525  } else if( action == "NEXT_TAB" || action == "PREV_TAB" ) {
526  if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::active && !passive.empty() ) {
527  tab_mode = mutation_tab_mode::passive;
528  } else if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::passive && !active.empty() ) {
529  tab_mode = mutation_tab_mode::active;
530  } else {
531  continue;
532  }
533  scroll_position = 0;
534  examine_pos = 0;
535  cursor = 0;
536  examine_id = GetTrait( active, passive, cursor, tab_mode );
537  } else if( action == "CONFIRM" ) {
538  trait_id mut_id;
539  if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::active ) {
540  mut_id = active[cursor];
541  } else if( tab_mode == mutation_tab_mode::passive ) {
542  mut_id = passive[cursor];
543  } else {
544  continue;
545  }
546  if( !mut_id.is_null() ) {
547  const mutation_branch &mut_data = mut_id.obj();
548  switch( menu_mode ) {
549  case mutation_menu_mode::reassigning: {
550  query_popup pop;
551  pop.message( _( "%s; enter new letter." ), mutation_name( mut_id ) )
552  .preferred_keyboard_mode( keyboard_mode::keychar )
553  .context( "POPUP_WAIT" )
554  .allow_cancel( true )
555  .allow_anykey( true );
556 
557  bool pop_exit = false;
558  while( !pop_exit ) {
559  const query_popup::result ret = pop.query();
560  bool pop_handled = false;
561  if( ret.evt.type == input_event_t::keyboard_char && !ret.evt.sequence.empty() ) {
562  const int newch = ret.evt.get_first_input();
563  if( mutation_chars.valid( newch ) ) {
564  const trait_id other_mut_id = trait_by_invlet( newch );
565  if( !other_mut_id.is_null() ) {
566  std::swap( my_mutations[mut_id].key, my_mutations[other_mut_id].key );
567  } else {
568  my_mutations[mut_id].key = newch;
569  }
570  pop_exit = true;
571  pop_handled = true;
572  } else if( newch == ' ' ) {
573  my_mutations[mut_id].key = newch;
574  pop_exit = true;
575  pop_handled = true;
576  }
577  }
578  if( !pop_handled ) {
579  if( ret.action == "QUIT" ) {
580  pop_exit = true;
581  } else if( ret.action != "HELP_KEYBINDINGS" &&
582  ret.evt.type == input_event_t::keyboard_char ) {
583  popup( _( "Invalid mutation letter. Only those characters are valid:\n\n%s" ),
584  mutation_chars.get_allowed_chars() );
585  }
586  }
587  }
588 
589  menu_mode = mutation_menu_mode::activating;
590  examine_id = std::nullopt;
591  // TODO: show a message like when reassigning a key to an item?
592  break;
593  }
594  case mutation_menu_mode::activating: {
595  if( mut_data.activated ) {
596  if( my_mutations[mut_id].powered ) {
597  add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "You stop using your %s." ), mutation_name( mut_data.id ) );
598  // Reset menu in advance
599  ui.reset();
600  deactivate_mutation( mut_id );
601  // Action done, leave screen
602  exit = true;
603  } else if( ( !mut_data.hunger || get_kcal_percent() >= 0.8f ) &&
604  ( !mut_data.thirst || get_thirst() <= 400 ) &&
605  ( !mut_data.sleepiness || get_sleepiness() <= 400 ) ) {
606  add_msg_if_player( m_neutral, _( "You activate your %s." ), mutation_name( mut_data.id ) );
607  // Reset menu in advance
608  ui.reset();
609  activate_mutation( mut_id );
610  // Action done, leave screen
611  exit = true;
612  } else {
613  popup( _( "You don't have enough in you to activate your %s!" ), mutation_name( mut_data.id ) );
614  }
615  } else {
616  popup( _( "You cannot activate %1$s! To read a description of "
617  "%1$s, press '!', then '%2$c'." ),
618  mutation_name( mut_data.id ), my_mutations[mut_id].key );
619  }
620  break;
621  }
622  case mutation_menu_mode::examining:
623  // Describing mutations, not activating them!
624  examine_id = mut_id;
625  break;
626  case mutation_menu_mode::hiding:
627  my_mutations[mut_id].show_sprite = !my_mutations[mut_id].show_sprite;
628  break;
629  }
630  }
631  } else if( action == "REASSIGN" ) {
632  menu_mode = mutation_menu_mode::reassigning;
633  examine_id = std::nullopt;
634  } else if( action == "TOGGLE_EXAMINE" ) {
635  // switches between activation and examination
636  menu_mode = menu_mode == mutation_menu_mode::activating ?
637  mutation_menu_mode::examining : mutation_menu_mode::activating;
638  if( menu_mode == mutation_menu_mode::examining ) {
639  examine_id = GetTrait( active, passive, cursor, tab_mode );
640  } else {
641  examine_id = std::nullopt;
642  }
643  examine_pos = 0;
644  } else if( action == "TOGGLE_SPRITE" ) {
645  menu_mode = mutation_menu_mode::hiding;
646  examine_id = std::nullopt;
647  } else if( action == "QUIT" ) {
648  exit = true;
649  }
650  }
651  }
652 }

◆ print_info()

int avatar::print_info ( const catacurses::window &  w,
int  vStart,
int  vLines,
int  column 
) const
overridevirtual

Write information about this creature.

Parameters
wthe window to print the text into.
vStartvertical start to print, that means the first line to print.
vLinesnumber of lines to print at most (printing less is fine).
columnhorizontal start to print (column), horizontal end is one character before the right border of the window (to keep the border).
Returns
The line just behind the last printed line, that means multiple calls to this can be stacked, the return value is acceptable as vStart for the next call without creating empty lines or overwriting lines.

Implements Creature.

◆ randomize()

void avatar::randomize ( bool  random_scenario,
bool  play_now = false 
)

Definition at line 422 of file newcharacter.cpp.

423 {
424  const int max_trait_points = get_option<int>( "MAX_TRAIT_POINTS" );
425  // Reset everything to the defaults to have a clean state.
426  *this = avatar();
427  bool gender_selection = one_in( 2 );
428  male = gender_selection;
429  outfit = gender_selection;
430  if( !MAP_SHARING::isSharing() ) {
431  play_now ? pick_name() : pick_name( true );
432  } else {
433  name = MAP_SHARING::getUsername();
434  }
435  randomize_height();
436  randomize_blood();
437  randomize_heartrate();
438  bool cities_enabled = world_generator->active_world->WORLD_OPTIONS["CITY_SIZE"].getValue() != "0";
439  if( random_scenario ) {
440  std::vector<const scenario *> scenarios;
441  for( const scenario &scen : scenario::get_all() ) {
442  if( !scen.has_flag( flag_CHALLENGE ) && !scen.scen_is_blacklisted() &&
443  ( !scen.has_flag( flag_CITY_START ) || cities_enabled ) && scen.can_pick().success() ) {
444  scenarios.emplace_back( &scen );
445  }
446  }
447  const scenario *selected_scenario = random_entry( scenarios );
448  if( selected_scenario ) {
449  set_scenario( selected_scenario );
450  } else {
451  debugmsg( "Failed randomizing sceario - no entries matching requirements." );
452  }
453  }
454 
455  prof = get_scenario()->weighted_random_profession();
456  init_age = rng( this->prof->age_lower, this->prof->age_upper );
457  starting_city = std::nullopt;
458  world_origin = std::nullopt;
459  random_start_location = true;
460 
461  str_max = rng( 6, HIGH_STAT - 2 );
462  dex_max = rng( 6, HIGH_STAT - 2 );
463  int_max = rng( 6, HIGH_STAT - 2 );
464  per_max = rng( 6, HIGH_STAT - 2 );
465 
466  set_body();
467  randomize_hobbies();
468 
469  int num_gtraits = 0;
470  int num_btraits = 0;
471  int tries = 0;
472  add_traits(); // adds mandatory profession/scenario traits.
473  for( const trait_id &mut : get_mutations() ) {
474  const mutation_branch &mut_info = mut.obj();
475  if( mut_info.profession ) {
476  continue;
477  }
478  // Scenario/profession traits do not cost any points, but they are counted toward
479  // the limit (MAX_TRAIT_POINTS)
480  if( mut_info.points >= 0 ) {
481  num_gtraits += mut_info.points;
482  } else {
483  num_btraits -= mut_info.points;
484  }
485  }
486 
487  /* The loops variable is used to prevent the algorithm running in an infinite loop */
488  for( int loops = 0; loops <= 100000; loops++ ) {
489  multi_pool p( *this );
490  bool is_valid = p.stat_points_left >= 0 && p.trait_points_left >= 0 && p.skill_points_left >= 0;
491  if( is_valid && rng( -3, 20 ) <= p.skill_points_left ) {
492  break;
493  }
494  trait_id rn;
495  if( num_btraits < max_trait_points && one_in( 3 ) ) {
496  tries = 0;
497  do {
498  rn = random_bad_trait();
499  tries++;
500  } while( ( has_trait( rn ) || num_btraits - rn->points > max_trait_points ) &&
501  tries < 5 );
502 
503  if( tries < 5 && !has_conflicting_trait( rn ) ) {
504  toggle_trait_deps( rn );
505  num_btraits -= rn->points;
506  }
507  } else {
508  switch( rng( 1, 4 ) ) {
509  case 1:
510  if( str_max > 5 ) {
511  str_max--;
512  }
513  break;
514  case 2:
515  if( dex_max > 5 ) {
516  dex_max--;
517  }
518  break;
519  case 3:
520  if( int_max > 5 ) {
521  int_max--;
522  }
523  break;
524  case 4:
525  if( per_max > 5 ) {
526  per_max--;
527  }
528  break;
529  }
530  }
531  }
532 
533  for( int loops = 0;
534  has_unspent_points( *this ) && loops <= 100000;
535  loops++ ) {
536  multi_pool p( *this );
537  const bool allow_stats = p.stat_points_left > 0;
538  const bool allow_traits = p.trait_points_left > 0 && num_gtraits < max_trait_points;
539  int r = rng( 1, 9 );
540  trait_id rn;
541  switch( r ) {
542  case 1:
543  case 2:
544  case 3:
545  case 4:
546  if( allow_traits ) {
547  rn = random_good_trait();
548  const mutation_branch &mdata = rn.obj();
549  if( !has_trait( rn ) && p.trait_points_left >= mdata.points &&
550  num_gtraits + mdata.points <= max_trait_points && !has_conflicting_trait( rn ) ) {
551  toggle_trait_deps( rn );
552  num_gtraits += mdata.points;
553  }
554  break;
555  }
556  /* fallthrough */
557  case 5:
558  if( allow_stats ) {
559  switch( rng( 1, 4 ) ) {
560  case 1:
561  str_max++;
562  break;
563  case 2:
564  dex_max++;
565  break;
566  case 3:
567  int_max++;
568  break;
569  case 4:
570  per_max++;
571  break;
572  }
573  break;
574  }
575  /* fallthrough */
576  case 6:
577  case 7:
578  case 8:
579  case 9:
580  const skill_id aSkill = Skill::random_skill();
581  const int level = get_skill_level( aSkill );
582 
583  if( level < p.skill_points_left && level < MAX_SKILL && loops > 10000 ) {
584  // For balance reasons, increasing a skill from level 0 gives you 1 extra level for free
585  set_skill_level( aSkill, ( level == 0 ? 2 : level + 1 ) );
586  }
587  break;
588  }
589  }
590 
591  randomize_cosmetics();
592 
593  // Restart cardio accumulator
594  reset_cardio_acc();
595 }

445  }

463  if( reader != this ) {

465  add_msg( m_info, _( "%s reads aloud…" ), reader->disp_name() );

476  dynamic_cast<const npc &>( *reader ).say( get_hint() );

486  const skill_id &skill = type->skill;
487  const std::string skill_name = skill ? skill.obj().name() : "";
488 
489  // Find NPCs to join the study session:
490  std::map<Character *, std::string> learners;
491  //reading only for fun
492  std::map<Character *, std::string> fun_learners;
493  std::map<Character *, std::string> nonlearners;
494  for( Character *elem : get_crafting_helpers() ) {
495  const book_mastery mastery = elem->get_book_mastery( *book );
496  const bool morale_req = elem->fun_to_read( *book ) || elem->has_morale_to_read();
497 
498  // Note that the reader cannot be a nonlearner
499  // since a reader should always have enough morale to read
500  // and at the very least be able to understand the book
501 
502  if( elem->is_deaf() && elem != reader ) {
503  nonlearners.insert( { elem, _( " (deaf)" ) } );
504 
505  } else if( mastery == book_mastery::MASTERED && elem->fun_to_read( *book ) ) {
506  fun_learners.insert( {elem, elem == reader ? _( " (reading aloud to you)" ) : "" } );
507 
508  } else if( mastery == book_mastery::LEARNING && morale_req ) {
509  learners.insert( {elem, elem == reader ? _( " (reading aloud to you)" ) : ""} );
510  } else {
511  std::string reason = _( " (uninterested)" );
512 
513  if( !morale_req ) {
514  reason = _( " (too sad)" );
515 
516  } else if( mastery == book_mastery::CANT_UNDERSTAND ) {
517  reason = string_format( _( " (needs %d %s)" ), type->req, skill_name );
518 
519  } else if( mastery == book_mastery::MASTERED ) {
520  reason = string_format( _( " (already has %d %s)" ), type->level, skill_name );
521 
522  }
523  nonlearners.insert( { elem, reason } );
524  }
525  }
526 
527  int learner_id = -1;
528  const bool is_martialarts = book->type->use_methods.count( "MA_MANUAL" );
529 
530  //only show the menu if there's useful information or multiple options
531  if( ( skill || !nonlearners.empty() || !fun_learners.empty() ) && !is_martialarts ) {
532  uilist menu;
533 
534  // Some helpers to reduce repetition:
535  auto length = []( const std::pair<Character *, std::string> &elem ) {
536  return utf8_width( elem.first->disp_name() ) + utf8_width( elem.second );
537  };
538 
539  auto max_length = [&length]( const std::map<Character *, std::string> &m ) {
540  auto max_ele = std::max_element( m.begin(),
541  m.end(), [&length]( const std::pair<Character *, std::string> &left,
542  const std::pair<Character *, std::string> &right ) {
543  return length( left ) < length( right );
544  } );
545  return max_ele == m.end() ? 0 : length( *max_ele );
546  };
547 
548  auto get_text = [&]( const std::map<Character *, std::string> &m,
549  const std::pair<Character *, std::string> &elem
550  ) {
551  const int lvl = elem.first->get_knowledge_level( skill );
552  const std::string lvl_text = skill ? string_format( _( " | current level: %d" ), lvl ) : "";
553  const std::string name_text = elem.first->disp_name() + elem.second;
554  return string_format( "%s%s", left_justify( name_text, max_length( m ) ), lvl_text );
555  };
556 
557  auto add_header = [&menu]( const std::string & str ) {
558  menu.addentry( -1, false, -1, "" );
559  uilist_entry header( -1, false, -1, str, c_yellow, c_yellow );
560  header.force_color = true;
561  menu.entries.push_back( header );
562  };
563 
564  menu.title = !skill ? string_format( _( "Reading %s" ), book->type_name() ) :
565  //~ %1$s: book name, %2$s: skill name, %3$d and %4$d: skill levels
566  string_format( _( "Reading %1$s (can train %2$s from %3$d to %4$d)" ), book->type_name(),
567  skill_name, type->req, type->level );
568 
569  menu.addentry( 0, true, '0', _( "Read once" ) );
570 
571  const int lvl = get_knowledge_level( skill );
572  menu.addentry( 2 + getID().get_value(), lvl < type->level, '1',
573  string_format( _( "Read until you gain a level | current level: %d" ), lvl ) );
574 
575  // select until player gets level by default
576  if( lvl < type->level ) {
577  menu.selected = 1;
578  }
579 
580  if( !learners.empty() ) {
581  add_header( _( "Read until this character gains a level:" ) );
582  for( const std::pair<Character *const, std::string> &elem : learners ) {
583  menu.addentry( 2 + elem.first->getID().get_value(), true, -1,
584  get_text( learners, elem ) );
585  }
586  }
587 
588  if( !fun_learners.empty() ) {
589  add_header( _( "Reading for fun:" ) );
590  for( const std::pair<Character *const, std::string> &elem : fun_learners ) {
591  menu.addentry( -1, false, -1, get_text( fun_learners, elem ) );
592  }
593  }
594 
595  if( !nonlearners.empty() ) {
596  add_header( _( "Not participating:" ) );
597  for( const std::pair<Character *const, std::string> &elem : nonlearners ) {
598  menu.addentry( -1, false, -1, get_text( nonlearners, elem ) );
599  }
600  }
601 
602  menu.query( true );
603  if( menu.ret == UILIST_CANCEL ) {
604  add_msg( m_info, _( "Never mind." ) );
605  return false;
606  } else if( menu.ret >= 2 ) {
607  continuous = true;
608  learner_id = menu.ret - 2;
609  }
610  }
611 
612  if( is_martialarts ) {
613 
614  if( martial_arts_data->has_martialart( martial_art_learned_from( *book->type ) ) ) {
615  add_msg_if_player( m_info, _( "You already know all this book has to teach." ) );
616  return false;
617  }
618 
619  uilist menu;
620  menu.title = string_format( _( "Train %s from manual:" ),
621  martial_art_learned_from( *book->type )->name );
622  menu.addentry( 1, true, '1', _( "Train once" ) );
623  menu.addentry( 2, true, '0', _( "Train until tired or success" ) );
624  menu.query( true );
625  if( menu.ret == UILIST_CANCEL ) {
626  add_msg( m_info, _( "Never mind." ) );
627  return false;
628  } else if( menu.ret == 1 ) {
629  continuous = false;
630  } else { // menu.ret == 2
631  continuous = true;
632  }
633  }
634 
635  add_msg( m_info, _( "Now reading %s, %s to stop early." ),
636  book->type_name(), press_x( ACTION_PAUSE ) );
637 
638  // Print some informational messages
639  if( reader != this ) {
640  add_msg( m_info, fail_messages[0] );
641  add_msg( m_info, _( "%s reads aloud…" ), reader->disp_name() );
642  } else if( !learners.empty() || !fun_learners.empty() ) {
643  add_msg( m_info, _( "You read aloud…" ) );
644  }
645 
646  if( learners.size() == 1 ) {
647  add_msg( m_info, _( "%s studies with you." ), learners.begin()->first->disp_name() );

650  learners.end(), [&]( const std::pair<Character *, std::string> &elem ) {

655 
656  // Don't include the reader as it would be too redundant.
657  std::set<std::string> readers;

659  if( elem.first != reader ) {
660  readers.insert( elem.first->disp_name() );
661  }
662  }
663

667  const std::string them = enumerate_as_string( readers );
668  add_msg( m_info, _( "%s read with you for fun." ), them );
669  }
670

672  add_msg( m_warning,
673  _( "It's difficult for %s to see fine details right now. Reading will take longer than usual." ),
674  reader->disp_name() );
675  }
676 
677  const int intelligence = get_int();
678  const bool complex_penalty = type->intel > std::min( intelligence, reader->get_int() ) &&
679  !reader->has_trait( trait_PROF_DICEMASTER );
680  const Character *complex_player = reader->get_int() < intelligence ? reader : this;
681  if( complex_penalty ) {
682  add_msg( m_warning,
683  _( "This book is too complex for %s to easily understand. It will take longer to read." ),
684  complex_player->disp_name() );

686

688  if( is_martialarts &&
689  get_stamina() < get_stamina_max() / 10 ) {
690  add_msg( m_info, _( "You are too exhausted to train martial arts." ) );
691  return false;
692  }
693

696  return true;

◆ rebuild_aim_cache()

void avatar::rebuild_aim_cache ( )

Definition at line 1248 of file avatar.cpp.

1249 {
1250  double pi = 2 * acos( 0.0 );
1251 
1252  const tripoint local_last_target = get_map().getlocal( last_target_pos.value() );
1253 
1254  float base_angle = atan2f( local_last_target.y - posy(),
1255  local_last_target.x - posx() );
1256 
1257  // move from -pi to pi, to 0 to 2pi for angles
1258  if( base_angle < 0 ) {
1259  base_angle = base_angle + 2 * pi;
1260  }
1261 
1262  // todo: this is not the correct weapon when aiming with fake items
1263  item *weapon = get_wielded_item() ? &*get_wielded_item() : &null_item_reference();
1264  // calc steadiness with player recoil (like they are taking a regular shot not careful etc.
1265  float range = 3.0f - 2.8f * calc_steadiness( *this, *weapon, last_target_pos.value(), recoil );
1266 
1267  // pin between pi and negative pi
1268  float upper_bound = base_angle + range;
1269  float lower_bound = base_angle - range;
1270 
1271  // cap each within 0 - 2pi
1272  if( upper_bound > 2 * pi ) {
1273  upper_bound = upper_bound - 2 * pi;
1274  }
1275 
1276  if( lower_bound < 0 ) {
1277  lower_bound = lower_bound + 2 * pi;
1278  }
1279 
1280  for( int smx = 0; smx < MAPSIZE_X; ++smx ) {
1281  for( int smy = 0; smy < MAPSIZE_Y; ++smy ) {
1282 
1283  float current_angle = atan2f( smy - posy(), smx - posx() );
1284 
1285  // move from -pi to pi, to 0 to 2pi for angles
1286  if( current_angle < 0 ) {
1287  current_angle = current_angle + 2 * pi;
1288  }
1289 
1290  // some basic angle inclusion math, but also everything with 15 is still seen
1291  if( rl_dist( tripoint( point( smx, smy ), pos().z ), pos() ) < 15 ) {
1292  aim_cache[smx][smy] = false;
1293  } else if( lower_bound > upper_bound ) {
1294  aim_cache[smx][smy] = !( current_angle >= lower_bound ||
1295  current_angle <= upper_bound );
1296  } else {
1297  aim_cache[smx][smy] = !( current_angle >= lower_bound &&
1298  current_angle <= upper_bound );
1299  }
1300  }
1301  }
1302 
1303  // set cache as no longer dirty
1304  aim_cache_dirty = false;
1305 }

979  }

992  }
